channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: China's Cyber Arsenal Exposed: Knownsec Breach Leaks State Hacking Tools and Global Target Lists
item.description:
Headline: China's Cyber Arsenal Exposed: Knownsec Breach Leaks State Hacking Tools and Global Target Lists

Summary:
A monumental data breach at Knownsec, a prominent Chinese cybersecurity firm with close government ties, has resulted in the exposure of over 12,000 classified documents. The leak, which occurred in early November 2025, provides an unprecedented view into China's offensive cyber capabilities, revealing a sophisticated arsenal of malware for multiple operating systems, custom hardware attack tools, and an extensive list of global espionage targets. The compromised data details large-scale data theft from countries including India, South Korea, and Taiwan, targeting critical infrastructure, government databases, and telecommunications networks, signaling a major intelligence failure for China's state-sponsored cyber operations.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A massive data breach at Chinese cybersecurity firm Knownsec has exposed a trove of state-sponsored hacking tools, malware, and global surveillance target lists, revealing large-scale data theft from multiple nations.

Article Slug: chinese-firm-knownsec-breached-exposing-state-hacking-tools-and-global-target-lists

Published Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: URGENT: QNAP Patches Seven Critical Zero-Days Allowing Full NAS Takeover
item.description:
Headline: URGENT: QNAP Patches Seven Critical Zero-Days Allowing Full NAS Takeover

Summary:
QNAP has issued urgent security updates to fix seven critical zero-day vulnerabilities affecting its QTS and QuTS hero NAS operating systems and several key applications. These flaws were successfully demonstrated at the Pwn2Own Ireland 2025 hacking competition, where research teams chained them to achieve complete, unauthenticated remote code execution on target devices. The vulnerabilities, which include stack-based buffer overflows and improper input validation, could allow attackers to bypass authentication, gain kernel-level control, and exfiltrate data. All QNAP users are strongly advised to apply the patches immediately to mitigate the significant risk of data breach and service disruption.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: QNAP has patched seven critical zero-day vulnerabilities in its NAS products, including QTS and QuTS hero, that were exploited at Pwn2Own Ireland 2025 to achieve remote code execution. Update immediately.

Article Slug: qnap-patches-seven-critical-zero-day-vulnerabilities-after-pwn2own-exploits

Published Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CRITICAL: runC Flaws Allow Container Escape, Granting Root on Docker & Kubernetes Hosts
item.description:
Headline: CRITICAL: runC Flaws Allow Container Escape, Granting Root on Docker & Kubernetes Hosts

Summary:
Three high-severity vulnerabilities have been disclosed in runC, the universal container runtime engine that underpins Docker, Kubernetes, and other major containerization platforms. Tracked as CVE-2025-31133, CVE-2025-52565, and CVE-2025-52881, these flaws could allow a malicious container to break out of its isolated environment and gain root-level access to the underlying host system. The vulnerabilities exploit race conditions and weaknesses in how runC handles file mounts and symlinks. Given runC's ubiquitous use, these flaws pose a widespread threat to cloud and DevOps environments. Patches are available, and administrators are urged to update their container runtimes immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Critical vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-31133, CVE-2025-52565, CVE-2025-52881) in the runC container runtime allow for container escape, granting root access to host systems. Affects Docker, Kubernetes, and more.

Article Slug: critical-runc-flaws-allow-container-escape-on-docker-and-kubernetes

Published Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Swedish IT Supplier Breach Exposes Personal Data of 1.5 Million Citizens
item.description:
Headline: Swedish IT Supplier Breach Exposes Personal Data of 1.5 Million Citizens

Summary:
The 'Datacarry' ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a major cyberattack on Miljödata, a Swedish IT supplier for local governments, exposing the sensitive personal data of up to 1.5 million people. The attack, which occurred in August 2025, targeted the company's HR systems, leading to the theft of names, government IDs, and contact information. The 224MB data archive was subsequently published on the dark web. The breach has caused service disruptions for numerous Swedish municipalities and affected data from major companies like SAS and Volvo. The incident is now under a national privacy investigation for potential GDPR violations.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A ransomware attack by the 'Datacarry' group on Swedish IT supplier Miljödata has exposed the personal data of 1.5 million people and impacted clients like SAS and Volvo, triggering a GDPR investigation.

Article Slug: swedish-it-supplier-miljodata-hit-by-breach-exposing-data-of-1-5-million-people

Published Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: EU Governments Under Siege: ENISA Reports Massive Surge in DDoS and Data Attacks
item.description:
Headline: EU Governments Under Siege: ENISA Reports Massive Surge in DDoS and Data Attacks

Summary:
A new threat landscape report from the EU Agency for Cybersecurity (ENISA) reveals that public administrations across the European Union are facing a dramatic increase in cyberattacks. DDoS attacks, largely driven by pro-Russia hacktivist groups like NoName057(16), account for 60% of all incidents, primarily targeting central governments. While disruptive, the report warns that data breaches (17.4%) and ransomware (10%) pose a more significant threat to the continuity of essential public services. ENISA also highlights ongoing espionage campaigns by Russian and Chinese state actors, and notes that the sector's immaturity under the new NIS2 Directive places it in a high-risk zone.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance, Cyberattack

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A new ENISA report finds EU public administrations are heavily targeted by DDoS attacks from hacktivists, as well as damaging data breaches and ransomware, putting essential services and citizen data at risk.

Article Slug: eu-public-administrations-face-surging-ddos-and-data-threats-enisa-reports

Published Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: It's Official: DoD Begins Phased Rollout of CMMC Cybersecurity Program
item.description:
Headline: It's Official: DoD Begins Phased Rollout of CMMC Cybersecurity Program

Summary:
The U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) has officially started the phased, three-year implementation of its Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification (CMMC) program as of November 10, 2025. DoD contracting officers can now begin inserting CMMC requirements into new solicitations for the Defense Industrial Base (DIB). The first phase requires contractors handling Federal Contract Information (FCI) or some Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) to perform self-assessments. More stringent third-party certification requirements for higher CMMC levels will be introduced in subsequent phases, with full implementation expected by late 2028, fundamentally changing the security landscape for all DoD contractors.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Security Operations

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: As of November 10, 2025, the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) has officially started the phased rollout of its CMMC program, which will mandate cybersecurity certification for all defense contractors.

Article Slug: dods-cmmc-program-officially-begins-phased-rollout

Published Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: OWASP Top 10 for 2025 Released, Spotlighting Supply Chain and Design Flaws
item.description:
Headline: OWASP Top 10 for 2025 Released, Spotlighting Supply Chain and Design Flaws

Summary:
The OWASP Foundation has released the 2025 release candidate for its influential Top 10 list of web application security risks. This update signals a major shift in focus, with the introduction of new categories like 'A03: Software Supply Chain Failures' and 'A10: Mishandling of Exceptional Conditions'. 'Broken Access Control' remains the top risk, but 'Security Misconfiguration' has climbed to the number two spot. The 2025 list emphasizes a move away from fixing individual bugs towards addressing systemic root causes like insecure design and dependency management, reflecting the modern threat landscape of complex, interconnected applications.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Policy and Compliance, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: The OWASP Foundation has released its 2025 Top 10 list, introducing new categories for Software Supply Chain Failures and highlighting the growing importance of secure design and configuration.

Article Slug: owasp-top-10-for-2025-released-highlighting-supply-chain-and-design-flaws

Published Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Akira Ransomware Hits US Manufacturer Koch & Co., Threatens to Leak 54GB of Data
item.description:
Headline: Akira Ransomware Hits US Manufacturer Koch & Co., Threatens to Leak 54GB of Data

Summary:
The Akira ransomware group has added U.S. manufacturer Koch & Co., Inc. to its list of victims. In a November 7 post on its dark web leak site, the group claimed to have stolen 54 gigabytes of sensitive corporate data, including detailed financials, contracts, and HR files. Akira is threatening to publish the data if a ransom is not paid. This attack is characteristic of Akira's double-extortion tactics, targeting mid-sized organizations with data exfiltration followed by encryption. Koch & Co. has not yet issued a public statement on the incident.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Akira ransomware group has claimed a cyberattack on U.S. manufacturer Koch & Co., alleging the theft of 54GB of sensitive corporate data including financials and HR files.

Article Slug: akira-ransomware-group-claims-attack-on-manufacturer-koch-and-co

Published Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: US Congressional Budget Office Hacked, Foreign State Actor Suspected
item.description:
Headline: US Congressional Budget Office Hacked, Foreign State Actor Suspected

Summary:
The U.S. Congressional Budget Office (CBO), a key nonpartisan federal agency, has confirmed it was the victim of a cyberattack perpetrated by a suspected foreign threat actor. The breach has raised serious national security concerns, as the attackers may have accessed sensitive economic data, draft legislation, and confidential communications between the CBO and Congress. Cybersecurity researchers suggest the attackers may have exploited a known vulnerability in an outdated Cisco ASA firewall that had not been patched since 2024. The incident has triggered an investigation and a warning to all congressional offices about potential data exposure.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The U.S. Congressional Budget Office (CBO) has confirmed a cyberattack by a suspected foreign threat actor, potentially through an unpatched Cisco ASA firewall, raising fears of widespread government data exposure.

Article Slug: us-congressional-budget-office-confirms-cyberattack-by-suspected-foreign-hackers

Published Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: OSCE Guide Urges Unified Cyber-Physical Defense for Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
Headline: OSCE Guide Urges Unified Cyber-Physical Defense for Critical Infrastructure

Summary:
The Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) has published a new technical guide advising governments and operators to adopt a unified approach to securing critical infrastructure. The guide emphasizes the growing convergence of physical and cybersecurity domains, warning that siloed security teams lack a holistic view of modern threats. It highlights how internet-connected Industrial Control Systems (ICS) have expanded the attack surface, making infrastructure vulnerable to remote cyberattacks. The document provides recommendations for integrating intrusion detection, access control, and insider threat management into a single, cohesive security framework.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Policy and Compliance, Security Operations

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: The Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) has released a new technical guide urging a unified approach to physical and cybersecurity for the protection of critical infrastructure.

Article Slug: osce-releases-new-guide-urging-unified-cyber-physical-security-for-critical-infrastructure

Published Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 10 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Washington Post Breached by Clop Ransomware via Oracle Flaws
item.description:
Headline: Washington Post Breached by Clop Ransomware via Oracle Flaws

Summary:
The Washington Post has officially confirmed it was a victim of a large-scale cyberattack orchestrated by the Clop ransomware group. The threat actors exploited vulnerabilities in Oracle's E-Business Suite, compromising over 100 organizations globally. The campaign involves data exfiltration followed by aggressive extortion tactics, with Clop publicly naming victims on its dark web leak site to pressure them into paying ransoms reportedly as high as $50 million. This incident underscores the significant risk posed by vulnerabilities in widely used enterprise software and the sophisticated, multi-faceted extortion methods employed by modern ransomware gangs.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Clop ransomware, Washington Post breach, Oracle E-Business Suite vulnerability, data extortion, cyberattack, TA505, ransomware campaign

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The Clop ransomware group has breached The Washington Post and over 100 other organizations by exploiting vulnerabilities in Oracle's E-Business Suite, leading to massive data theft and extortion.

Article Slug: washington-post-confirms-breach-in-massive-oracle-software-attack

Published Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Microsoft 'Whisper Leak' Attack Can Spy on Encrypted AI Chats
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft 'Whisper Leak' Attack Can Spy on Encrypted AI Chats

Summary:
Microsoft researchers have discovered a novel side-channel attack method named 'Whisper Leak' that undermines the privacy of encrypted AI chatbot conversations. By analyzing the size and timing of encrypted data packets from streaming Large Language Models (LLMs), a passive network observer can accurately infer the topic of a conversation. The proof-of-concept attack achieved over 98% accuracy against models from OpenAI, Mistral, xAI, and DeepSeek. While major AI providers have already implemented mitigations following a responsible disclosure, the finding exposes a fundamental privacy risk in the architecture of streaming LLMs, particularly for users in sensitive sectors like law and healthcare.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Intelligence, Cloud Security

Article Type: TechArticle

Keywords: Whisper Leak, AI privacy, side-channel attack, LLM security, encrypted traffic analysis, Microsoft, OpenAI

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft researchers detail 'Whisper Leak,' a new side-channel attack that can infer the topic of encrypted AI chat sessions by analyzing network traffic patterns, posing a major privacy risk.

Article Slug: microsoft-reveals-whisper-leak-attack-infers-ai-chat-topics-from-encrypted-traffic

Published Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: GlassWorm Malware Hits VSCode Marketplace, Stealing Dev Credentials
item.description:
Headline: GlassWorm Malware Hits VSCode Marketplace, Stealing Dev Credentials

Summary:
The financially motivated GlassWorm malware campaign has returned, targeting developers through the OpenVSX marketplace for Visual Studio Code. Security researchers discovered three malicious VSCode extensions published on November 8, 2025, which have already been downloaded over 10,000 times. The malware is designed to steal developer credentials, including GitHub and NPM tokens, and exfiltrate data from 49 different cryptocurrency wallet extensions. In a novel twist, the malware uses Solana blockchain transactions to fetch its malicious payload, complicating detection and takedown efforts. The extensions remain active, posing an ongoing threat to the software development community.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: GlassWorm malware, VSCode extension attack, OpenVSX security, software supply chain, developer credential theft, Solana C2

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The GlassWorm malware has returned in a supply chain attack, using malicious Visual Studio Code extensions on the OpenVSX marketplace to steal developer credentials and cryptocurrency.

Article Slug: glassworm-malware-returns-in-vscode-marketplace-supply-chain-attack

Published Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: QNAP Patches 7 Zero-Days Allowing Full NAS Takeover
item.description:
Headline: QNAP Patches 7 Zero-Days Allowing Full NAS Takeover

Summary:
QNAP has issued urgent security updates to address seven zero-day vulnerabilities affecting its QTS, QuTS hero, and related software. These critical flaws were successfully exploited by security researchers at the Pwn2Own Ireland 2025 hacking contest in October, demonstrating paths to unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) and full system takeover. The vulnerabilities, including buffer overflows and path traversal issues, impact the NAS operating systems as well as integrated applications like HBS 3 Hybrid Backup Sync and Malware Remover. QNAP users are strongly urged to apply the patches immediately to protect their data from potential attack.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: QNAP zero-day, Pwn2Own 2025, QNAP vulnerability, CVE-2025-62847, NAS security, remote code execution

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: QNAP has patched seven critical zero-day vulnerabilities in its NAS operating systems (QTS, QuTS hero) that allow for remote code execution, following their exploitation at Pwn2Own 2025.

Article Slug: qnap-patches-seven-zero-day-vulnerabilities-from-pwn2own-2025

Published Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Chinese-Made Electric Buses in Europe & Australia Pose Remote Shutdown Risk
item.description:
Headline: Chinese-Made Electric Buses in Europe & Australia Pose Remote Shutdown Risk

Summary:
Cybersecurity tests conducted in Norway on November 7, 2025, have uncovered a significant security risk in Chinese-manufactured Yutong electric buses, which are widely used across Europe and Australia. The 'Lion Cage' experiment demonstrated that the buses' connected systems could theoretically be accessed and disabled remotely by the manufacturer. The findings have triggered urgent security reviews by public transit authorities in multiple countries, highlighting the growing national security concerns surrounding internet-connected critical infrastructure and potential vulnerabilities in international supply chains.

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Yutong electric bus, cybersecurity, critical infrastructure, remote shutdown, Norway, supply chain risk, connected vehicle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Cybersecurity tests in Norway show that Chinese-made Yutong electric buses, used widely in Europe and Australia, could be remotely disabled, raising major national security concerns.

Article Slug: security-risk-found-in-chinese-made-electric-buses-across-europe-australia

Published Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Accenture Report: 90% of Firms Unprepared for AI-Powered Cyberattacks
item.description:
Headline: Accenture Report: 90% of Firms Unprepared for AI-Powered Cyberattacks

Summary:
A new report from Accenture, 'State of Cybersecurity Resilience 2025,' reveals a critical gap in corporate defenses against AI-augmented cyberattacks. The study, surveying over 2,200 executives, found that only 10% of organizations are 'Reinvention Ready' with adaptive and resilient security postures. A concerning 63% are in the 'Exposed Zone,' relying on reactive and insufficient defenses. The report highlights that AI adoption is rapidly outpacing security implementation, with 77% of firms lacking the necessary security practices to protect their AI models and data pipelines, creating a significant and growing business risk.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Threat Intelligence, Regulatory

Article Type: Report

Keywords: Accenture report, AI cyberattacks, cybersecurity resilience, AI security, generative AI risk, security governance

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Accenture's 'State of Cybersecurity Resilience 2025' report finds 90% of organizations are unprepared for AI-driven cyberattacks, with most operating with reactive and fragmented defenses.

Article Slug: only-10-percent-of-firms-ready-for-ai-powered-cyberattacks-accenture-report

Published Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Indian MP Proposes National Council to Standardize Cybersecurity Certifications
item.description:
Headline: Indian MP Proposes National Council to Standardize Cybersecurity Certifications

Summary:
On November 9, 2025, Indian MP Praveen Khandelwal formally requested that the central government establish a National Cybersecurity Certification Council. The proposal aims to standardize cybersecurity education and professional certifications across India to address the growing talent gap and combat a recent surge in cyber fraud and data breaches. By promoting globally recognized certifications like CEH and CCISO, the council would seek to build a skilled workforce, enhance national cyber defense capabilities, and support the 'Digital India' initiative.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Other

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: National Cybersecurity Certification Council, India cybersecurity, Praveen Khandelwal, cybersecurity education, Digital India

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: An Indian MP has formally proposed the creation of a National Cybersecurity Certification Council to standardize cybersecurity education and certifications to combat rising cybercrime.

Article Slug: indian-mp-urges-government-to-create-national-cybersecurity-certification-council

Published Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Philippines Lawmakers Push for National Cybersecurity Fund
item.description:
Headline: Philippines Lawmakers Push for National Cybersecurity Fund

Summary:
In the Philippines, Representatives Migz and Luigi Villafuerte have introduced a proposal to create a 'Cybersecurity Risk Management and Mitigation Fund' (CRMMF). This dedicated national fund would provide the government with the necessary resources to prevent and respond to cyberattacks against both public and private sector entities. The proposal comes after recent DDoS attack attempts on local banks and designates 30% of the fund for rapid restoration of critical information infrastructure, signaling a strong political push to enhance the nation's cyber resilience.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Incident Response

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Philippines cybersecurity, Cybersecurity Risk Management and Mitigation Fund, CRMMF, Villafuerte, DICT Philippines

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Lawmakers in the Philippines have proposed a dedicated national Cybersecurity Risk Management and Mitigation Fund to finance prevention and response to cyberattacks on government and businesses.

Article Slug: philippines-lawmakers-propose-dedicated-national-cybersecurity-fund

Published Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Warns of 'Payroll Pirates' Phishing Gang Targeting M365 Credentials
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Warns of 'Payroll Pirates' Phishing Gang Targeting M365 Credentials

Summary:
Microsoft has issued a warning about a sophisticated phishing campaign dubbed 'Payroll Pirates.' The attackers impersonate HR departments in targeted emails to lure employees into giving up their Microsoft 365 credentials. The campaign uses spoofed domains and legitimate Microsoft Forms to appear authentic. The ultimate goal of the operation is to gain access to employee accounts, alter their direct deposit information, and divert their payroll to attacker-controlled bank accounts. This form of Business Email Compromise (BEC) attack poses a direct financial threat to employees, and Microsoft urges organizations to enable multi-factor authentication as a key defense.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Payroll Pirates, phishing campaign, Microsoft 365 security, BEC attack, payroll diversion, MFA

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft is warning about a new 'Payroll Pirates' phishing campaign where attackers impersonate HR departments to steal Microsoft 365 credentials and reroute employee payroll.

Article Slug: microsoft-warns-of-payroll-pirates-phishing-campaign

Published Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Critical Container Escape Flaws in runC Threaten Docker & Kubernetes
item.description:
Headline: Critical Container Escape Flaws in runC Threaten Docker & Kubernetes

Summary:
A security alert issued on November 9, 2025, warns of three new critical vulnerabilities in runC, the low-level container runtime used by Docker, Kubernetes, and other major container platforms. The flaws could allow a malicious actor to execute a 'container escape,' breaking out of the isolated container environment to gain unauthorized access to the underlying host operating system. A successful container escape is a worst-case scenario in cloud-native security, as it would allow an attacker to compromise all other containers on the host. Administrators of all containerized environments are urged to monitor for and apply patches immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Patch Management

Article Type: TechArticle

Keywords: runC vulnerability, container escape, Docker security, Kubernetes security, cloud native security, CVE

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Three critical new vulnerabilities have been found in runC, the core container runtime for Docker and Kubernetes, which could allow attackers to escape container isolation and access the host OS.

Article Slug: critical-flaws-in-runc-container-runtime-threaten-docker-kubernetes

Published Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Over 75% of Orgs Can't Keep Pace with AI-Powered Attacks, Survey Finds
item.description:
Headline: Over 75% of Orgs Can't Keep Pace with AI-Powered Attacks, Survey Finds

Summary:
A new survey from CrowdStrike reveals a stark reality: 76% of global organizations admit they cannot match the speed and sophistication of AI-powered cyberattacks. The 2025 State of Ransomware Survey highlights a dangerous 'confidence illusion,' where leaders believe they are prepared, yet 78% of their organizations were attacked in the past year. With adversaries using AI to accelerate attacks, 89% of security leaders now agree that AI-powered protection is essential to close the widening security gap and defend against modern threats.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Ransomware, Policy and Compliance

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A CrowdStrike survey reveals 76% of organizations struggle to match the speed of AI-powered attacks, highlighting a 'confidence illusion' among leaders and the urgent need for AI-driven cyber defenses.

Article Slug: 76-percent-of-orgs-cant-match-speed-of-ai-powered-attacks

Published Date: Wed, 22 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 22 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 09 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

item.title: UPDATE: Pwn2Own Day 1: Hackers Net $522K for 34 Zero-Days in SOHO Devices
item.description:
Headline: Pwn2Own Day 1: Hackers Net $522K for 34 Zero-Days in SOHO Devices

Summary:
The first day of Trend Micro's Pwn2Own Ireland 2025 competition was a resounding success for security researchers, who earned a total of $522,500 for demonstrating 34 unique zero-day vulnerabilities. In a stunning display, every single one of the 17 scheduled attempts against popular SOHO devices—including printers, NAS devices, and smart home products from brands like QNAP, Synology, Canon, and HP—was successful. The highlight was a complex 'SOHO Smashup' that chained eight bugs to compromise a router and a NAS device.

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, IoT Security, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: On Day 1 of Pwn2Own Ireland 2025, security researchers earned $522,500 by demonstrating 34 zero-day vulnerabilities against popular SOHO devices from QNAP, Synology, Canon, and HP with a 100% success rate.

Article Slug: pwn2own-ireland-day-1-hackers-earn-522k-for-34-zero-days

Published Date: Wed, 22 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT
